column12: Small cartridge free optical disc with high level of redundancy and tolerance for missing data
column13: In the invention, e-book information is distributed on un-cartridged small media that can be made cheaply enough for use in free distribution of information. The e-book information is encoded and stored on a read-only optical disc that is 2 to 4 cm in diameter and 0.6 to 1.2 mm thick, the information being encoded with sufficient redundancy and sufficient tolerance for missing information that the disc can be conveniently handled and pocketed without losing reliability of information access. The disc has a lead-in area that is prior to all the e-book information and that contains a disc navigation area, and a lead-out area that follows all the e-book information. The disc may include multiple partitions, each partition containing sufficient access information for independent access of the e-book information within the partition without accessing any other partition. Alternatively, the disc may include multiple slots for files and that are equally spaced. For example, to provide data redundancy, at least some of the partitions are duplicate partitions that contain all the same data as another duplicate partition, and the disc navigation area contains partition descriptors that indicate all the partitions and the areas allocated to each of the partitions, and the disc also includes duplicates of the partition descriptors, the duplicate partition descriptors being stored in the lead-in area or in the lead-out area to provide redundancy of navigation information.
column15: THOMAS JOHNSON MARK;;HENDRIK BERGMAN ANTHONIE;;BROEILS LUITJENS STEVEN;;GUOFO ZHOU;;HE DER AA MICHAEL ADRIANUS VAN;;CORNELIS PENNING FRANK

column12: HEAT TREATING APPARATUS FOR SEMICONDUCTOR WAFER
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To raise the output efficiency of a heat treating apparatus to improve the heating uniformity by coating the wall of a transparent reactor with a wavelength-selective layer which allows ultraviolet and visible radiations to enter the reactor but blocks the emission of infrared radiations. SOLUTION: A chamber has a wavelength-selective coating 16 to receive the radiation energy from lamp heater elements 18 and lamp reflector 20. The chamber 12 is made of an optically transparent material e.g. quartz highly allowing ultraviolet rays and/or visual lights (of about 200-800nm wavelength). The coating 16 is selected among many wavelength-selective materials which reflect infrared rays such as In-Sn-oxide (ITO), Sb-Sn-oxide, undoped Sn oxide and dichroic filters and allows lights at about 200-800nm wavelength to pass.
column15: GHEZZO MARIO;;PAGE TIMOTHY DIETRICH;;GORCZYCA THOMAS BERT;;BERGMAN ROLF SVERRE;;VAKIL HIMANSHU BACHUBHAI;;HUEY CHARLES SAMUEL;;SILVERSTEIN SETH DAVID

column12: Thermal processor for semiconductor wafers
column13: A thermal processor for at least one semiconductor wafer includes a reactor chamber (12) having a material substantially transparent to light including a wavelength within the range of about 200 nanometers to about 800 nanometers for holding the at least one semiconductor wafer. A coating (16) including a material substantially reflective of infrared radiation can be present on at least a portion of the reactor chamber. A light source (18) provides radiant energy to the at least one semiconductor wafer through the coating and the reactor chamber. The light source can include an ultraviolet discharge lamp, a halogen infrared incandescent lamp, or a metal halide visible discharge lamp. The coating can be situated on an inner or outer surface of the reactor chamber. If the reactor chamber has inner and outer walls, the coating can be situated on either the inner wall or the outer wall.

column12: artigo absorvente contendo uma composição polimérica superabsorvente particulada com estabilidade melhorada
column13: resumo artigo absorvente contendo uma composição polimérica superabsorvente particulada com estabilidade melhorada a presente invenção refere-se a um artigo absorvente que contém uma folha superior; uma folha posterior; um núcleo absorvente disposto entre a folha superior e a folha posterior, o núcleo absorvente compreendendo uma composição polimérica superabsorvente particulada tendo uma estabilidade melhorada compreendendo um polímero que compreende de cerca de 0,01% em peso a cerca de 5% em peso de uma solução de sal de alumínio neutralizado aplicada à superfície de uma composição polimérica superabsorvente particulada; caracterizada por uma solução aquosa do sal de alumínio neutralizado que tem um valor de ph de cerca de 5,5 a cerca de 8 e a composição polimérica superabsorvente particulada tem uma permeabilidade do leito de gel ao intumescimento livre inicial (fsgbp) de cerca de 20x10-8 cm2 a cerca de 200 x10-8 cm2 e uma compressibilidade de cerca de 1,30 mm2/n a cerca de 4 mm2/n antes de submeter a composição polimérica superabsorvente particulada ao teste de processamento; e a subsequente sujeição ao teste de processamento, a composição polimérica superabsorvente particulada tem um índice de estabilidade de permeabilidade de cerca de 0,60 a cerca de 0,99.

column12: METHOD FOR MAKING SALTS OF HYDROXY-SUBSTITUTED HYDROCARBONS
column13: Disclosed is a method for preparing an alkali metal salt of a hydroxy- substituted hydrocarbon which comprises the steps of (i) contacting in solvent media at least one hydroxy-substituted hydrocarbon with a base comprising an alkali metal cation; and (ii) devolatilizing the solvent media comprising alkali metal salt by adding or spraying the solvent media into a substantially water-immiscible organic solvent, said solvent being at a temperature greater than the boiling point of solvent media at the prevailing pressure. In one embodiment the solvent media comprises water, and optionally at least one water-soluble protic organic solvent.

column12: Pyridine carboxamide orexin receptor antagonists
column13: The present invention is directed to pyridyl carboxamide compounds which are antagonists of orexin receptors, and which are useful in the treatment or prevention of neurological and psychiatric disorders and diseases in which orexin receptors are involved. The invention is also directed to pharmaceutical compositions comprising these compounds and the use of these compounds and compositions in the prevention or treatment of such diseases in which orexin receptors are involved.

column12: Signage system
column13: The present invention relates to a signage system (10) comprising: a plurality of textile products (12) each comprising a flexible display device (16). For controlling the displays (16), the system further comprises a central unit (14, 24) adapted to emit at least one control signal, each of which being a sound signal or a light signal. To this end, each textile product further comprises means (20, 26) for detecting the control signal (s) emitted by the central unit (14, 24), and means (18) linked to the detection means (20, 26) and display (16) for controlling the display (16) in accordance with the detected control signal(s). The present invention also relates to a method, central units and uses of such for controlling a plurality of flexible display devices each comprised in a textile product.
column15: KRANS MARTIJN;;BERGMAN ANTHONIE HENDRIK;;VAN DE SLUIS BARTEL MARINUS;;ZAINZINGER ERICH;;ZEPER WOUTER BASTIAAN;;LAMERICHS GUIDO THEO MARIA;;SCHUELER THOMAS

column12: METHOD FOR MAKING SALTS OF HYDROXY-SUBSTITUTED HYDROCARBONS
column13: Disclosed is a method for preparing an alkali metal salt of a hydroxy-substituted hydrocarbon which comprises the steps of (i) contacting in solvent media at least one hydroxy-substituted hydrocarbon with a base comprising an alkali metal cation; and (ii) devolatilizing the solvent media comprising alkali metal salt by adding or spraying the solvent media into a substantially water-immiscible organic solvent, said solvent being at a temperature greater than the boiling point of solvent media at the prevailing pressure. In one embodiment the solvent media comprises water, and optionally at least one water-soluble protic organic solvent.

column12: SIGNAGE SYSTEM
column13: The present invention relates to a signage system ( 10 ) comprising a plurality of textile products ( 12 ), wherein each textile product comprises a flexible display device ( 14 ) adapted to show a display content forming part of a unified message. The system is characterized in that each flexible display device ( 14 ) further is adapted to show an indication of the position of the display content of the flexible display device in relation to the display contents of the other flexible display devices in the unified message, before showing the display content. The present invention also relates to a method for presenting a unified message by means of a plurality of flexible display devices ( 14 ) each comprised in a textile product ( 12 ).

column12: ENHANCED ENERGY DELIVERY MECHANISM FOR BULK SPECIALTY GAS SUPPLY SYSTEMS
column13: A system for delivering vapor phase fluid at an elevated pressure from a transport vessel containing liquefied or two-phase fluid is provided. The system includes: (a) a transport vessel positioned in a substantially horizontal position; (b) one or more energy delivery devices disposed on the lower portion of the transport vessel wherein the energy delivery devices include a heating means and a thermally conductive non-adhesive layer disposed therebetween to the gaps and provide substantially uniform energy to the transport vessel.

column12: TEXTILE PRODUCT
column13: The present invention relates to a textile product (10), such as a shirt. The textile product comprises a flexible display device (12), and is characterized by a clock (20) and a control unit (14) linked to the clock (20) and flexible display device (12). The control unit (14) is adapted to determine a starting time associated with a specific display content and to initiate the showing of the display content on the flexible display device (12) at the associated starting time with reference to the clock (20).

column12: ABSORPTION ARTICLE
column13: Stretchable absorbent articles, such as sanitary napkins, pantiliners, or incontinence pads are described that are provided improved stretching mechanisms for maintaining the absorbent articles in contact with the wearer's body and mechanisms which provide the absorbent article with improved ability to cover and, thus protect, the wearer's undergarments, clothing bedding, bedding, etc. from soiling.

column12: Absorption article
column13: The invented absorption article main body (21) has asymmetric form and its other end region (30) intended for placing on rear part of the bearer body and extending from a central region (32) is both greater in area if compared with a first end region (28) intended for placing on the front part of the bearer body and its maximum width, measured in the direction perpendicular to the main body (21) longitudinal axis (L) compared with maximum width of the first end region (28) is in ratio ranging from 1.1 : 1 to 2.7 :1. Both an upper layer (38) and a bottom layer (40) of the main body (21) are resolved into at least one first region (64) and at least one second region (66), from which the first region (64) is smooth and the second region (66) contains a system of continuous a interconnected rib-like deformations (74), whereby side wrapping elements (52) have their edges (57) projecting from the main body (21) end parts (24A, 24B) arranged with respect to the longitudinal axis (L) under an angle (alpha), that is equal to or greater than 90 degrees and next to each end part (24A, 24B) of the main body (21) there is arranged an additional end fastener (82) formed by a layer (84) of non-spread adhesive.

column12: Extensible absorbent articles for wearing in a wearer's undergarment
column13: An extensible absorbent article for wearing in a wearer^s undergarment, in which the absorbent article comprises a longitudinally directed longitudinal dimension and a transversally directed transversal dimension, a first end area, a second end area, and an intermediate area located between the first end area and the second end area, in which the absorbent article comprises: a main body part comprising a liquid permeable top sheet, a liquid impermeable back sheet, and an absorbent core located between the top sheet and the back sheet; in which the main body part has an initial relaxed dimension when being flattened and measured for the distance between two marks of the two corresponding sides of the median on the back sheet; and the main body part has an elongated dimension larger than the initial relaxed dimension when being worn of which the elongated dimension is measured for the distance between the two marks in the longitudinal and transversal direction of the absorbent article.

column12: ABSORPTIVE ARTICLE
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an absorptive article which prevents underwear, clothes, bedding, or the like, from being soiled by leaking urine, menstrual blood, or the like, when a user wears the article.

SOLUTION: This absorptive article is so structured that an expansible material and a material for a top sheet and a back sheet are placed by considering their placement so as to hold the absorptive article in a condition in contact with a wearer's body. A suitably extensible material is selected for the expansible absorptive article for a sanitary napkin, a panty liner or a incontinence preventing pad, which is provided with a mechanisms to cover underwear of the user and to prevent underwear, clothes, bedding, or the like, from soiling.

column12: Patterned optical interference coatings for electric lamps
column15: DAVENPORT JOHN MARTIN;;GOLZ THOMAS MICHAEL;;BERGMAN ROLF SVERRE;;AHLGREN FREDERIC FRANCIS;;ALLEN GARY ROBERT;;DUFFY MARK ELTON;;HANSLER RICHARD LOWELL;;PARHAM THOMAS GENE;;DYNYS FREDERICK WALTER;;GUNTER CARL VERNON

column12: A process for forming patterned optical interference coatings for electric lamps
column13: A process for forming patterned optical interference coatings on the external surface of a lamp envelope involves forming a boric oxide mask on the lamp envelope, applying the optical interference filter to the envelope and removing the boric oxide coating and the optical interference filter applied thereon. A boric oxide precursor such as tributyl borate or trimethoxyboroxine may be used to form the mask, followed by conversion to boric oxide. The mask may be removed by dissolving the boric oxide in aqueous solution.
column15: PARHAM THOMAS GENE;;DYNYS FREDERICK WALTER;;GUNTER CARL VERNON;;DAVENPORT JOHN MARTIN;;GOLZ THOMAS MICHAEL;;BERGMAN ROLF SVERRE;;AHLGREN FREDERIC FRANCIS;;ALLEN GARY ROBERT;;DUFFY MARK ELTON;;HANSLER RICHARD LOWELL
column27: H1F FE            FE;;H1F F2A1D         FE;;H1F F2A1G3        FE;;H1F F4A3          FE

column12: Patterned optical interference coatings for only a portion of a high intensity lamp envelope
column13: An interference filter or coating is provided in a predetermined pattern on a lamp envelope. The coating is comprised of alternating layers of high and low index of refraction materials applied to a vitreous outer surface of a lamp envelope. The coating may be geometrically symmetric or asymmetric, continuous or discontinuous with respect to the coating itself or the envelope to which it has been applied. The envelope can be masked prior to deposition of the coating so that removal of the mask leaves the filter in the desired pattern. The preferred process for forming the coating includes forming a boric oxide mask on a portion of the envelope, applying the coating over the mask and removing the coating from masked areas of the envelope by dissolving the mask in an aqueous solution.

column12: Source lumineuse à filtre optique interférentiel, procédé de formation d'un tel filtre et système d'éclairage muni d'une telle source lumineuse.
column13: Ce filtre ou revêtement interférentiel (90) est formé suivant une configuration ou dessin prédéterminé sur la surface de l'enveloppe de la lampe (54), en couches alternées d'indices de réfraction haut et bas, de façon symétrique ou asymétrique, continue ou discontinue. L'enveloppe peut être masquée avant le dépôt du revêtement de telle sorte que l'enlèvement du masque laisse le filtre suivant la configuration désirée. On forme le revêtement en déposant un masque en acide borique par l'enveloppe, on applique le revêtement sur le masque et on élimine le masque dans les régions masquées par dissolution dans une solution aqueuse.

column12: RADIO FREQUENCY IDENTIFICATION (RFID) TAG WITH DEACTIVATABLE LINK
column13: An electronic article surveillance ("EAS") tag for an EAS system, comprising an antenna, a radio frequency identification ("RFID") chip configured to transmit and/or receive a wireless signal via the antenna; and a magnetically-actuatable switch configured to move between a first position and a second position. The switch is configured to electrically couple the RFID chip to the antenna in the first position. The switch is further configured to electrically decouple the RFID chip from the antenna in the second position.

column12: SMALL CARTRIDGE FREE OPTICAL DISC WITH HIGH LEVEL OF REDUNDANCY AND TOLERANCE FOR MISSING DATA
column13: In the invention, e-book information is distributed on un-cartridged small media that can be made cheaply enough for use in free distribution of information. The e-book information is encoded and stored on a read-only optical disc that is 2 to 4 cm in diameter and .6 to 1.2 mm thick, the information being encoded with sufficient redundancy and sufficient tolerance for missing information that the disc can be conveniently handled and pocketed without losing reliability of information access. The disc has a lead-in area that is prior to all the e-book information and that contains a disc navigation area, and a lead-out area that follows all the e-book information. The disc may include multiple partitions, each partition containing sufficient access information for independent access of the e-book information within the partition without accessing any other partition. Alternatively, the disc may include multiple slots for files and that are equally spaced. For example, to provide data redundancy, at least some of the partitions are duplicate partitions that contain all the same data as another duplicate partition, and the disc navigation area contains partition descriptors that indicate all the partitions and the areas allocated to each of the partitions, and the disc also includes duplicates of the partition descriptors, the duplicate partition descriptors being stored in the lead-in area or in the lead-out area to provide redundancy of navigation information.

column12: Small cartridge free optical disc with high level of redundancy and tolerance for missing data
column13: An optical disc comprises a substrate about 2 to 4 cm in diameter and about 0.6 to 1.8 mm thick, at least one information layer containing predetermined embossed windings of spiral or circular tracks and an area of embossed marks on the windings representing information, and multiple partitions to which the windings are allocated, each partition containing sufficient access information for independent access of the data within the partition without accessing any other partition. At least some of the partitions are duplicate partitions that contain all the same data as another duplicate partition. The disc also includes a lead-in area that is prior to any partitions in a normal scanning direction and that contains a disc navigation area that contains partition descriptors that indicate all the partitions and the areas, and a lead-out area following the last partition. A system for playing the disc is also provided in the invention.
column15: THOMAS JOHNSON MARK;;JOHANNES FONTIJN WILHELMUS FRANCISCUS;;HENDRIK BERGMAN ANTHONIE;;BROEILS LUITJENS STEVEN;;GUOFU ZHOU;;HENRICUS DER AA MICHAEL ADRIANUS VAN;;CORNELIS PENNING FRANK

column12: SMALL CARTRIDGE FREE OPTICAL DISC WITH HIGH LEVEL OF REDUNDANCY AND TOLERANCE FOR MISSING DATA
column13: In the invention, e-book information is distributed on un-cartridged small media that can be made cheaply enough for use in free distribution of information. The e-book information is encoded and stored on a read-only optical disc that is 2 to 4 cm in diameter and .6 to 1.2 mm thick, the information being encoded with sufficient redundancy and sufficient tolerance for missing information that the disc can be conveniently handled and pocketed without losing reliability of information access. The disc has a lead-in area that is prior to all the e-book information and that contains a disc navigation area, and a lead-out area that follows all the e-book information. The disc may include multiple partitions, each partition containing sufficient access information for independent access of the e-book information within the partition without accessing any other partition. Alternatively, the disc may include multiple slots for files and that are equally spaced. For example, to provide data redundancy, at least some of the partitions are duplicate partitions that contain all the same data as another duplicate partition, and the disc navigation area contains partition descriptors that indicate all the partitions and the areas allocated to each of the partitions, and the disc also includes duplicates of the partition descriptors, the duplicate partition descriptors being stored in the lead-in area or in the lead-out area to provide redundancy of navigation information.

column12: SMALL CARTRIDGE FREE OPTICAL DISC WITH HIGH LEVEL OF REDUNDANCY AND TOLERANCE FOR MISSING DATA
column13: IN THE INVENTION, E-BOOK INFORMATION IS DISTRIBUTED ON UN-CARTRIDGED SMALL MEDIA THAT CAN BE MADE CHEAPLY ENOUGH FOR USE IN FREE DISTRIBUTION OF INFORMATION. THE E-BOOK INFORMATION IS ENCODED AND STORED ON A READ-ONLY OPTICAL DISC (110) THAT IS 2 TO 4 CM IN DIAMETER AND .6 TO 1.2 MM THICK, THE INFORMATION BEING ENCODED WITH SUFFICIENT REDUNDANCY AND SUFFICIENT TOLERANCE FOR MISSING INFORMATION THAT THE DISC (110) CAN BE CONVENIENTLY HANDLED AND POCKETED WITHOUT LOSING RELIABILITY OF INFORMATION ACCESS. THE DISC (110) HAS A LEAD-IN AREA (126) THAT IS PRIOR TO ALL THE E-BOOK INFORMATION AND THAT CONTAINS A DISC NAVIGATION AREA (128), AND A LEAD-OUT AREA (132) THAT FOLLOWS ALL THE E-BOOK INFORMATION. THE DISC MAY INCLUDE MULTIPLE PARTITIONS (120, 121, 122, 123), EACH PARTITION CONTAINING SUFFICIENT ACCESS INFORMATION FOR INDEPENDENT ACCESS OF THE E-BOOK INFORMATION WITHIN THE PARTITION WITHOUT ACCESSING ANY OTHER PARTITION. ALTERNATIVELY, THE DISC (110) MAY INCLUDE MULTIPLE SLOTS (151, 152, 153 AND 154) FOR FILES AND THAT ARE EQUALLY SPACED. FOR EXAMPLE, TO PROVIDE DATA REDUNDANCY, AT LEAST SOME OF THE PARTITIONS ARE DUPLICATE PARTITIONS THAT CONTAIN ALL THE SAME DATA AS ANOTHER DUPLICATE PARTITION, AND THE DISC NAVIGATION AREA (128) CONTAINS PARTITION DESCRIPTORS (130) THAT INDICATE ALL THE PARTITIONS AND THE AREAS ALLOCATED TO EACH OF THE PARTITIONS, AND THE DISC (110) ALSO INCLUDES DUPLICATES OF THE PARTITION DESCRIPTORS, THE DUPLICATE PARTITION DESCRIPTORS BEING STORED IN THE LEAD-IN AREA (126) OR IN THE LEAD-OUT AREA (128) TO PROVIDE REDUNDANCY OF NAVIGATION INFORMATION.

column12: ENHANCED ENERGY DELIVERY MECHANISM FOR BULK SPECIALTY GAS SUPPLY SYSTEMS
column13: A system for delivering vapor phase fluid at an elevated pressure from a transport vessel containing liquefied or two-phase fluid is provided. The system includes: (a) a transport vessel positioned in a substantially horizontal position; (b) one or more energy delivery devices disposed on the lower portion of the transport vessel wherein the energy delivery devices include a heating means and a thermally conductive non-adhesive layer disposed therebetween to the gaps and provide substantially uniform energy to the transport vessel.

column12: Radio frequency identification (RFID) tag with deactivatable link
column13: The present disclosure relates to an electronic article monitoring ("EAS") tag for an EAS system, the EAS tag comprising an antenna, a radio frequency identification ("RFID") chip configured to transmit and/or receive wireless signals via the antenna, and a magnetically actuatable switch configured to move between a first position and a second position. The switch is configured to electrically couple the RFID chip to the antenna at the first position. The switch is further configured to decouple the RFID chip from the antenna in the second position.

column12: ABSORBENT ARTICLE CONTAINING A PARTICULATE SUPERABSORBENT POLYMER COMPOSITION HAVING IMPROVED STABILITY AND FAST ABSORPTION
column13: The present invention relates to an absorbent article comprising a topsheet, backsheet, and an absorbent core disposed between the topsheet and backsheet, the absorbent core comprising a fast particulate superabsorbent polymer composition comprising a polymer comprising a neutralized aluminum salt solution applied to the surface of a particulate superabsorbent polymer; wherein an aqueous solution of the neutralized aluminum salt has a pH value from about 5.5 to about 8; and subsequent to subjecting the particulate superabsorbent polymer composition to the Processing Test, the particulate superabsorbent polymer composition has a permeability stability index of from about 0.60 to about 0.99, and a compressibility from 1.30mm 2 /N to about 4mm 2 /N as measured by the Compression Test, and wherein the particulate superabsorbent polymer having a Vortex time of from 25 to 60 seconds and absorbency under load at 0.9psi of from 15 to 21g/g.

column12: System for enhanced gas dissolution having a hood positioned over the impeller with segregating rings
column13: A system for the dissolution of gas in a large body of liquid comprising an impeller positioned below the surface of the large body of liquid; a floating hood positioned over the impeller and of sufficient size to capture undissolved gas; a conduit for introducing a feed gas stream beneath the floating hood and directly into the large body of liquid; at least one segregation ring positioned under the floating hood and extending below the surface of the large body of liquid such that a first inner region between the ring and the impeller, and a second outer region between the ring and an outer diameter of the floating hood are created, and a back pressure regulator located in the floating hood adjacent to the outer diameter of the floating hood.

column12: HOUSING CONNECTING DEVICE FOR CONNECTING HOUSING SECTIONS OR HOUSING MODULES OF VENTILATION OR AIR-CONDITIONING SYSTEMS
column13: The invention relates to a housing connecting device for connecting two housing sections or housing modules of a ventilation or air-conditioning system to each other, with at least in each case two first connecting elements (1) which are fastened to the operating and rear side of a first housing section or of a first housing module, with in each case at least one pawl (3), with at least in each case two second connecting elements (2) which are fastened to the operating and rear side of an adjacent second housing section or of an adjacent second housing module and each have one latching tooth (Z1) or two latching teeth (Z1, Z2) for preliminary latching and final latching of the pawl, wherein the connecting elements are attached either on the outer side or inner side of the housing sections or housing modules.

column12: ENHANCED GAS DISSOLUTION
column13: PURPOSE: An efficient oxygenation system positioned in a lagoon or other large body of liquid is provided. CONSTITUTION: An impeller or impeller/draft tube assembly is covered by an air/recirculating gas separation baffle or floating hood means, and supported or floated in a large liquid body. Gas, such as oxygen or carbon dioxide, is injected under the baffle or floating hood and is ingested into the suction of the impeller. The system is employed without a confining outer tank for the liquid. Liquid rich in dissolved gas and any undissolved gas are discharged from the bottom of the draft tube. The undissolved gas floats toward the surface and is recovered by said baffle or floating hood means for recirculation to the impeller or impeller/draft tube assembly. The liquid with dissolved gas distributes into the large liquid body.
column15: CHENG ALAN TAT YAN;;CLARK STEVEN DONALD;;BON PAULO SERGIO;;BERGMAN THOMAS JOHN JR;;KINGSLEY JEFFERY PAUL;;KIRBY MARK HERBERT;;ADIS MITCHELL;;COPPOLA VICTOR ALEXANDER

column12: Limited-accessibility data carrier
column13: An apparatus (10) for providing access to data recorded on a data carrier (20), said access being intentionally limited to a substantially predetermined number of access sessions. The apparatus (10) comprises: (a) an optical reading head (120) for reading data from the data carrier (20); (b) a mechanism (160, 180) through which or past which the data carrier (20) is conveyed when being introduced into the apparatus (10) for reading data therefrom using the reading head (120), and through which or past which the data carrier (20) is thereafter conveyed during use and/or when being extracted after use from the apparatus (10). The mechanism (160, 180) conveys the data carrier (20) without substantially damaging the data carrier (20) to the reading head (120), and at least partially damages (250) the data carrier (20) during use and/or when the data carrier (20) is extracted from the apparatus (10). The at least partial damage (250) intentionally renders data subsequently difficult to read or unreadable from the data carrier (20).

column12: DEVICE FOR CONNECTION OF HOUSING SECTIONS OR MODULES OF FANS OR AIR CONDITIONERS
column13: FIELD: ventilation.SUBSTANCE: invention relates to appliance for connection between two case sections or fan or air conditioner modules. Device, characterized by that there are at least two first connecting elements fixed on working and on rear side of first body section or first body module, each respectively, at least, with one ratchet carrier, at least, two closed on the rear and on the working side of the jointed second body section or docked second housing module of the second connecting element, respectively, each, respectively, with one or two toothed latches for preliminary and final latching ratchet pawls, wherein connecting elements are installed both on external and internal side of body sections or body modules, wherein first connecting element has ledge and two recesses, and second connecting element has two ledges and recess to provide geometrical closure, wherein first coupling element has spring hook made up of spring-loaded steel sheet with its free end forming locking latch.EFFECT: this allows to create a structurally simple and easy-to-use connection system, which provides the possibility of simple and reliable attachment to each other without the use of tools of rectangular sections or modules of fans or air conditioners, even if they are not accessed.7 cl, 5 dwg

column12: ENHANCED GAS DISSOLUTION
column13: Oxygen or other gases are dissolved in large bodies of liquid by injection under a baffle for passage into a submerged hollow draft-tube-impeller means assembly for downward passage therein. Liquid containing dissolved gas is dispersed throughout the body of liquid, while any undissolved gas is effectively recovered and recycled. An embodiment specially designed for use with oxygen containing gases having less than 96 vol.% oxygen is also disclosed.
column15: ADIS MITCHELL;;BON PAULO SERGIO;;COPPOLA VICTOR ALEXANDER;;CLARK STEVEN DONALD;;KINGSLEY JEFFREY PAUL;;KIRBY MARK HERBERT;;BERGMAN THOMAS JOHN JR;;CHENG ALAN TAT YAN

column12: Sistema para dissolução de gás dentro de uma grande massa de lìquido.
column13: "SISTEMA PARA DISSOLUçãO DE GáS DENTRO DE UMA GRANDE MASSA DE LìQUIDO" Oxigênio e outros gases são dissolvidos em grandes massas de líquido por intermédio de injeção sob um defletor para entrada em uma montagem de meio de impulsor de tubo de descarga para passagem descendente dentro da mesma. Líquido contendo gás dissolvido é disperso através da massa de líquido, enquanto que qualquer gás não dissolvido é efetivamente recuperado e reciclado. Uma modalidade especialmente projetada para uso com gases contendo oxigênio possuindo menos do que 96% em volume de oxigênio também é descrita.

column12: APPARATUS FOR PROMOTING GAS DISSOLUTION
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an apparatus which can efficiently dissolve oxygen in a large amount of a liquid by covering an impeller or an impeller/draft pipe assembly with an air/recirculation gas separation baffle or a floating hood means to cause the impeller or the assembly to be supported by or to float on a large amount of a liquid. SOLUTION: A baffle means 2 is fixed in a large amount of a liquid 1, e.g. in a lake or marsh, a tank, or a lagoon, with a float 3 or the like. Below the baffle means 2, a hollow draft pipe 4 is placed, in which an impeller means 5 is positioned. The impeller means 5 is driven by a drive motor 7 via a drive shaft 6. Near below the baffle means 2, oxygen supplied from a line 8 is injected into the liquid 1 and is absorbed by the sucking action of the impeller means 5. Oxygen not dissolved in the liquid is caused to ascend after a predetermined flow pattern 10 in the vicinity of the draft pipe 4, is caught with the baffle means 2, and is lead to return to the impeller means 5 in the draft pipe 4.

column12: (Re)writable disk with e-label
column13: A storage medium for storing digital information is disclosed. The storage medium comprises a label comprising a light addressable electrophoretic ink layer. Further, a method for labeling a storage medium provided with an electrophoretic ink label is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: applying a voltage between a first and a second electrode being arranged on mutual sides of a electrophoretic ink layer; irradiating selected pixel areas of the electrophoretic ink for addressing a change of visual state. Further, a recorder for an optical storage medium and a label writer for labeling an optical storage medium are disclosed. The recorder and the label writer comprise a light source and a charging device. The charging device is arranged to apply an electric field across an electrophoretic ink layer of the storage medium, and the light source is arranged to write a label on said storage medium by addressing pixel areas of said electrophoretic ink layer.

column12: MACHINE ROTOR ULTRASONIC IMAGING SYSTEM AND RELATED METHODS
column13: Various embodiments include an ultrasonic detection method, performed using an ultrasonic detection system having a set of corresponding transmitting phased array devices and receiving phased array devices, the method including: for each of a plurality of static positions about a portion of a machine rotor: transmitting, at a corresponding transmitting phased array device, a set of ultrasonic waves through the portion of the machine rotor, and receiving, at the corresponding receiving phased array device, the set of ultrasonic waves after transmission through the portion of the machine rotor, to obtain a set of ultrasonic detection information about the machine rotor; and forming an ultrasonic representation of the machine rotor by aligning the sets of the ultrasonic detection information about the machine rotor obtained from each of the plurality of static positions about the portion of the machine rotor.

column12: (Re) Writable Disk with Electrophoetic Ink Label
column13: A storage medium for storing digital information is disclosed. The storage medium comprises a label comprising a light addressable electrophoretic ink layer. Further, a method for labeling a storage medium provided with an electrophoretic ink label is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of applying a voltage between a first and a second electrode being arranged on mutual sides of a electrophoretic ink layer; irradiating selected pixel areas of the electrophoretic ink for addressing a change of visual state. Further, a recorder for an optical storage medium and a label writer for labeling an optical storage medium are disclosed. The recorder and the label writer comprise a light source and a charging device. The charging device is arranged to apply an electric field across an electrophoretic ink layer of the storage medium, and the light source is arranged to write a label on said storage medium by addressing pixel areas of said electrophoretic ink layer.

column12: Reciprocating compressor with vapor injection system
column13: A compressor may include a compression cylinder, a compression piston, a crankshaft, an injection bore, a position sensor, and a valve assembly. The compression piston is disposed within the compression cylinder and is operable to compress a vapor disposed within the compression cylinder from a suction pressure to a discharge pressure. The crankshaft is operable to cycle the compression piston within the compression cylinder. The injection bore may be in fluid communication with the compression cylinder and may be operable to selectively communicate intermediate-pressure vapor at a pressure between the suction pressure and said discharge pressure to the compression cylinder. The position sensor may measure a rotational position of the crankshaft. The valve assembly may be associated with the injection bore. The valve assembly may be operable to control passage of fluid from the injection bore into the compression cylinder in response to data provided by the position sensor.

column12: Method for propagating look and feel in a graphical user interface
column13: A method for rendering a graphical user interface (GUI), comprising providing for the representation of the GUI as a set of controls wherein the controls are organized in a logical hierarchy, traversing the representation, wherein the traversing comprises associating a theme with a first control in the set of controls, rendering the first control according to the theme, rendering any descendents of the first control according to the theme wherein any descendents of the first control can override the theme; and wherein one of the set of controls can communicate with another of the set of controls.

column12: Graphical user interface navigation method
column13: A method for navigating a graphical user interface (GUI) having at least one page, comprising providing a first booklet, wherein user interaction with the first booklet can cause the GUI to navigate to a new page; providing a request based on user interaction with the first booklet; mapping the request to a control tree factory; generating a control tree from the factory based on the request wherein the control tree includes a booklet control corresponding to the first booklet; advancing the control tree through at least one lifecycle stage based on the request; and generating a response wherein the response can be used to render the new page.

column12: FOAM COMPOSITION INCLUDING SURFACE-MODIFIED NANOPARTICLES AND RELATED ARTICLES AND PROCESSES
column13: A foam composition includes a vehicle, surface-modified nanoparticles disposed in the vehicle, and at least one of a silicone MQ resin or a poly(alkyleneoxide)-modified polydimethylsiloxane. The individual nanoparticles having a particle diameter of less than about 100 nanometers. The vehicle can have voids therein. Articles including the foam composition and processes for making the foam composition and articles are also described.

column12: FOAM COMPOSITION INCLUDING SILICONE MQ RESINS AND RELATED ARTICLES AND PROCESSES
column13: A foam composition includes a vehicle having voids therein and a silicone MQ resin. The vehicle comprises at least one of an organic, non-silicone containing polymer or an organic monomer. The foam composition comprises not more than 50 percent by weight water. Articles including the foam composition and processes for making the foam composition and articles are also described.

column12: SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR INSPECTING CYLINDRICAL MEMBERS
column13: An inspection system for a cylindrical member includes at least one retention member positionable about at least a portion of a circumference of the cylindrical member. The inspection system also includes a positioning system and at least one housing. The at least one housing is coupleable to the at least one retention member at each of a series of circumferential inspection locations. The at least one housing includes at least one probe. The positioning system cooperates with the at least one retention member to position the at least one probe at each of the circumferential locations. The at least one probe is configured to send and receive a signal through an interior of the cylindrical member.
